website_summaries.verdict: A good-looking fitness-tracking smartwatch that's intuitive and packed with features. Expensive, but worth it for consumers who like its sporty looks and preloaded apps.
pros: Has over 15 preloaded fitness apps for tracking your favorite exercise activities, plus tracks numerous fitness metrics
Can store as many as 500 songs to set your workouts to music
Features a stylish, sporty design that's available in several fashionable colors
cons: Battery life is diminished when fully synced

customer_reviews.title: Wow - way cheaper than previous models...
customer_reviews.text: It's July now, for reference. I bought this in June and the wrist strap broke, but not like a convenient break, the way they designed this makes the case break instead of the pins or the strap itself, so I sent it back for repair - all good. On my new one (replacement), the optical sensor quit working after about 3 days.... WOW!!! My previous vivoactive worked for over 2 years and two of these have had infant mortality issues... NOT what i've come to expect from Garmin. Spend your money on something else is my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Shooter mcgavin

customer_reviews.title: Spotify !
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever smart watch, it took a little bit of time to sync with my iphone 8 but once is done it works well. things i would like to highlight: - i bought it only for the offline spotify feature, it gorks great, i never take my phone for long runs again, only the watch and my wireless backbeat headphones. - water proof 100%, i use it when swimming and track my laps, works great - i have it sync'ed with my mapmy run app, once i get home the data transfers and i can keep track of it - very nice trendy design, way nicer than the apple watch very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Laura E. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the watch "version"
customer_reviews.text: Garmin recently released the Spotify app to download music into the vivoactive 3 music. However, while they state that the app is compatible with this Garmin watch model, it now seems to be the case (I contacted Garmin customer support) that there's an Asian/SEA version of the watch -which looks exactly the same- that is NOT compatible with the Spotify app. This is quite ridiculous as I bought mine at the amazon US store. This is also not an acceptable excuse from Garmin... Very very disappointed at this...
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Pablo Costa

customer_reviews.title: Good on paper, garbage in execution
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch. On paper it looked like a nice alternative to the Fitbit Ionic. Unfortunately it is complete garbage. Things that don’t work, or don’t work reliably: Step tracking- apparently I took 100 steps sitting still in my chair. Heart rate tracking - I promise my resting heart rate is not 45 beats per minute. Less then half of each day even has heart rate data. Sleep tracking - Apparently I haven't slept in days. Stair tracking - 15 flights of stairs, counted as 9. Stairs are 12 feet tall, so not a short stairway problem. This device is terrible. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value to get into Garmin watches. I had previously been wearing an activity tracker without GPS and was looking for something a little nicer. I considered some of the higher end Garmin watches but they were a little out of my price range. This has most of the features I wanted without being too expensive. Six months in I am incredibly happy with the purchase. It does a great job tracking what I am interested in and looks nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Had a Vivoactive original and it was a great watch (still have it) - but this is so much better. The heart rate is good and maybe the shape is not as great, but the whole thing is so much better - responsive to touch, functions much more accessible, comfortable, reasonably attractive and seems to be very sturdy. Battery life at 5 days is a little less but still better than most alternatives and connection to bluetooth has been flawless. Little disappointed in that the music does not include things like audible books but I can live without and hope that it comes in the future (or an equivalent).
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it’s the cheapest watch you can get that enables Spotify offline. Been using for 2 weeks now and I’m enjoying it. Had some issues during the start up: couldn’t connect to spotify and it got stuck during software update via WiFi. I had to hook it up to the pc to update the software , which was a bit of a hassle. But after that, it work fine. Sometimes during the run there are some small cuts in the BT connection, let’s see how it will perform in the long run
customer_reviews.author: Stella Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for music and exercise
customer_reviews.text: Got this Garmin Vívoactive 3 Music watch for my wife when she's exercising. She had gotten tired of carrying her phone with her, especially outside, and I love my Garmin watch for GPS, so we gave it a shot. She's very happy. No issues connecting to her bluetooth headphones, definitely more accurate than her FitBit watch was on tracking distance, and it holds a charge pretty well. When it comes to holding a charge, if you're using the music and GPS together, the battery will definitely discharge much more quickly, but it charges back up quicker than a lot of other watches we've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Mile High Colt

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for running!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I upgraded from Forerunner 15. The vivoactive 3 music linked great to my Android device (Note 8) with Garmin connect. It took me a few days to find the permission on my Android to allow texts to come to my watch but now it works great! Battery lasts a long time and as a fairly serious runner it has everything I need. The app is awesome. HR monitor seems accurate. Pacing chart from run is very useful. I haven't put music on it yet, but it works great to control music on my phone. I would recommend this watch to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Gone with the wind
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It does practically everything. It even connects to my hearing aids (which were not supposed to be supported). It's easy to use and I just love how it prints out maps with the elevation, pace, HR, map and other info about the workout. The only trouble I had was doing weight/resistance work outs. It didn't really record all of the reps. I did not purchase the Garmin for this purpose, but I thought I 'd try it. It was worth the money. Now I can train appropriately and be Gone with the wind!
customer_reviews.author: B Snov

customer_reviews.title: Meh watch - very inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for myself and one for my wife. Mine does not vibrate, my wife's watch takes forever to find satellites. The battery life is no good, typically 2-4 days at best. The heart rate monitoring is good for running, cycling but bad for everything else. The GPS quality is very good and mine finds satellites within about 20 seconds, which is very convenient. I have been using Garmin watches for 10 years and had a vivoactive 2 for several years. I would not recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: Definately great all around
customer_reviews.text: I tried various different fitness trackers / smart watches before settling on this one. The battery life is phenomenal compared to what you get - always on screen + notifications for 3+ days! The galaxy watch could barely match this with lots of settings off to ensure battery life lasted. This is simple, does not feel super heavy like the galaxy watch, and the software is great - especially for strength training. It even has auto rep count! If you like something practical, not flashy, and functional, go with this!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge B.

customer_reviews.title: Buggy!
customer_reviews.text: Froze in less than 12 hours. Opened it the evening it arrived, played a little. Got spotify set up. Charged it overnight. Woke up. Tried to wake up the screen. It vibrated then the screen dimmed and now it just shows a very faint cog and doesn't respond to input. We will see if they replace it with something that works. Update. It unfroze. I'll give another update after I give it time. Geezer this is frustrating. Music needs to randomly be resynced with zero explanation. If you try to restart, the screen will go grey for about 1 hour. Then it will not work right for running for a bit. Bad ui.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. T.

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch for the money
customer_reviews.text: I run and strength train, and I wanted a watch that would track workouts, and allow me to leave my phone behind. I was apprehensive at first, because of the low price point, but was pleasantly surprised at how great of a device this was for the money. I am training for a half marathon, and enjoy using the garmin coach feature, that allows you to pick a plan that fits your style and go. It really does push me to beat yesterday. I would highly recommend this as a great running watch, especially sub $200 I feel it is more accurate than the apple watch for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but I regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: What I liked- the battery life is impressive it lasts for several days. What I dislike- to me it’s it looks much cheaper in person than in the pictures. It reminds me of an old first generation digital watch. The graphic presentation looks like something from 20 years ago. Also, the glass is already broken. For the money I really wish I would have gone with another option.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a birthday gift in early October... A couple of months later he still raves about how much he loves it. He wears it every day. He does HVAC and is outside in all kinds of weather, crawling through wet crawlspaces, outside in the pouring rain, and working with his hands all day. It has held up perfectly and he can't go a day without wearing it. He loved the sleep tracking and stress indicator. He finds it to be very accurate. I highly recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Carter

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: Seems reasonable to operate. Some activity features feel/work on the amateur level. Main reason for purchase was the mp3 storage, to run with out cords, phone or iPod. Paired with my Bose Freesport wireless headphones, this setup is abysmal. Poor connection. Poor sound quality. Constant disruption to playback. Will try a few more times and then will likely return for uselessness.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spiva

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch for the average runner!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best Garmin watch for the average runner. If you don’t care about detailed statistics that the high-end watches provide than for sure get this. It looks great, has just the right amount of features and the fact that it stores music is the best. Feels so good to run without a cellphone!
customer_reviews.author: YishaiBD

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but Battery Not perfect YET.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. Garmin guys: almost there. Am a Triathlete and runner, and have purchased many Garmin products . Observations/suggestions: Battery life should be extended. Difficult to select watch faces-- overmuch, too many, too much. Hard to navigate to secure estimated age. Overall good job and improved over previous versions. Almost there- suggest putting a telephone answering answering and talking ability into your next version-got rid of my Apple watch- good product but not for serious athletes. Have a good one and enjoy. John.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device for amateur athletes
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for about 6 weeks and it works well. Much better than the samsung device I had (gear fit2 pro). I very much like it and the quality of device. The touch screen is easy to use. Only down side is smart phone app does not allow export of any measured data ... neither heart nor activity info. Displayed info is well laid out and easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT get this watch! Runners beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is the absolute WORST! For the first month is was fine, however after six months I have a glitch or an issue every time I pick it up to use it! My Spotify music mysteriously disappears, it won’t connect to any of my Bluetooth headsets(I have three different pairs, and they are all different brands so I don’t want to hear it’s my headphones) and sometimes it won’t turn on at all. It freezes and glitches anytime I run over 20 minutes which results in me having to reset it and it loses my run details. Super annoying! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Naimah

customer_reviews.title: heart rate is inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate (HR) function is horrible. I can workout for 60 minutes in cardio and the watch tells me my average HR is 90 - 100. I will wear a chest strap and the HR average is 125-135. The watch has basically become a step counter. So frustrating. I do like that it works great in the pool and this is the only reason I'm keeping it. I tried the Versa in the pool... Fried immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Very good watch, but the music feature is not very good
customer_reviews.text: I have been loving the Vivoactive 3. It is very easy to use, with cool graphs and features. However, if I could go back, I would not pay the additional dollars for the music feature. First of all, it can only be used with Deezer (and other less popular music players). So, for me who used to use Spotify, was an inconvenient. Besides that, the connectivity between the watch and the headphone is not very good, a lot of noise in the sound. My goal buying the Vivoactive 3 Music (instead of the Vivoactive 3), was to be able to leave my cellphone home during my activity, but it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Carlini

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Vivoactive to this one and not looking back at all. Love the integrated heart rate. It is surprisingly active. I've used it on several runs, lifting workouts, metcons... amazing. My only issue I run into is the bluetooth connection with my headphones seems to be weak at first, it eventually gets better on the run, but will sporadically cut in/out during the first 10 minutes or so. I could probably fix by putting it on my right arm, but I like it on the left. Other than that, I'm very pleased and impressed.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Not Google Play Music Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Overall was impressed with the build quality and look, but unfortunately the watch does not support Google Play Music which was a major bummer. Bought it as a gift for my boyfriend and him not having to worry about taking his phone on runs and still being able to track and listen to music was the entire appeal of this watch. Because, he couldn't use it with his music subscription unfortunately had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: convenient mp3 player for running
customer_reviews.text: I use this Garmin Vívoactive 3 Music Smartwatch for running. The GPS accuracy is good. The heart-rate monitor is a great feature. But I mostly bought it for the convenience of listening to music while running. It holds a lot of mp3 files and sounds great connected to my Phaiser BHS-530 Bluetooth Headphones (
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Fine Watch, Unless You Care About Distance & Rate Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: On four occasions, (twice yesterday!) my watch stops accurately measuring my rate and distance run. Yesterday,it measured my running rate at around 34min/mile. It was actually 12min/mi. To fix this, I need to pause and unpause the watch. That usually takes care of it, but again yesterday it happened again within a few minutes. This does not always happen, but when it does it's always around mile 19. I have posted about this issue to the Garmin forum with no response. I plan on returning the watch because if I can't trust it to accurately measure my run, what good is it?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor is surprisingly accurate
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised by how accurate the heart rate monitor is on this watch. I had read reviews about inconsistencies, but it's working great for me. Battery life is great, lasts about a week. The only draw back I've experienced is not being able to upload my runs to "Map my Run". No scoffing, I chose it over Strava way back in the day, so I have a long history with it. Just wish these watches interacted better with 3rd party running applications.
customer_reviews.author: T & K

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: It can tell you the time, your heart rate, stress level, hours slept, weather, incoming messages/calls, record your activities, record your steps, etc.... I use an app called health sync to sync my activities to Google Fit. This watch makes tracking my health so much easier. Truly a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: FAFSA

customer_reviews.title: SCRATCHED AND CONSTANTLY FAILING TO SYNC
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed with this watch. I personally have an apple watch and they two don't even compare. The lack of features, the backlight is very dim (I do know how to change this setting, even at the highest brightness it was still dim), and the versatility is low on options for apps. I purchased this watch as a gift and the original watch was a non US version and could not connect to GPS, when contacting Garmin directly they sent a replacement that came SCRATCHED! Sent that one back, and the second replacement was SCRATCHED AGAIN! When I reached out to the seller for a refund they denied it! Definitely do not recommend this seller or this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Bands are too short to fit average fit male
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this if Garmin comes clean about to the band only fitting small medium to small wrists and replaces the band. If you're a male, or woman with medium sized wrists, then this watch won't fit you without spending at least $30 (up to $60 for a large) for a new band. Nothing in the product description says you have to be 5'8" and 140lbs to buy this item. I own other Garmin wearables and feel seriously deceived on this one. Merry Christmas, Garmin!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BGinCA

customer_reviews.title: I do like it
customer_reviews.text: I have the old Vivoactive. LIke it, but like this better. Easier to ready. slightly bigger letters, numbers, etc. Easy enough to program. Use for golf and works well. Has more golf features then old one, not as much as a golf watch, but plenty for me. Seems very accurate. Easy to select other trainings (swim, running, walking, biking, etc). WOuld buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley L Frohman

customer_reviews.title: This watch was a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had the watch for 8 months and it was problematic, to say the least. Every update brought new issues: battery life, wifi connectivity and headphone connectivity were all recurring problems. They replaced the watch once, but the issues didn't go away. I just wish I read the Garmin forums before I bought it, and I recommend anyone reading this also check out the Garmin forums before buying any model of Garmin watch. You'll get a good idea how people feel about their Garmin products there (spoiler: NOT GREAT). Long story short, this watch is a piece of junk. I switched to an Apple watch and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: chris close

customer_reviews.title: Hidden gem smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I can't deal with iPhone, so I was checking out Wear OS watches, and I was having trouble finding what I wanted, which was a reliable fitness watch with built-in timers and heart rate monitor, decent battery life, music, and integration with my Pixel 3 for messages (and a "find your phone" feature for when I lose the phone, which is kind of a lot). This watch has all of these things. It makes trying to get in shape both fun and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Cheshire Iguana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, flexible, smart watch in every way and impressive service after the sale.
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: 4 months in my excellent watch developed a white spot at 10 o'clock position (see photo). Stuff happens, but they have a 1 year warranty, right? I call Garmin, they give me an RMA and ask for the watch only back (no bands, charging cable, etc.). A week later in the mail I get a brand new-in-box complete package. What's not to love about that? They don't tell you it will be new (and maybe it always isn't) but this left me a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Battery life getting shorter with each recharge
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the watch, the battery charge would last 5-6 days as long as I wasn't using the GPS or playing music. Now, with the same aps and same usage, the watch requires recharge after 2-3 days. Don't like the trend. This is what has discouraged me from buying any of the new models currently on sale.
customer_reviews.author: L. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: My fiance wanted a fitness tracker and I got him this one for his birthday. I originally was going to get him a FitBit but decided on this instead and kept the FitBit for myself. He loves the Garmin! It looks great and he says it's very comfortable. It has a ton of features and seems to be very accurate in its tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTRATED, I wasted my money, don't do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money, it doesn't work, it is ok for 3 days or a month or even 2 months but then stops working, I called Garmin, Amazon, Seller and nobody helps, battery not charging, heart rate sensor is terrible and stopped working, GPS stopped working, sleeping feature is terrible, music feature does not work, you are warned that this is a terrible product, I think Garmin knows this wasn't ok since the very beginning but they don't want to do a massive recall, FRUSTRATION, FRUSTRATION and FRUSTRATION
customer_reviews.author: Jose Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Garmin watch. I got the one with music capabilities and I was able to download my Spotify playlists onto my watch to listen to music while I am working out. I also enjoy that is acts as a smart watch and shows me my notifications and calls. Great way to be less on my phone! I also like the different watch face options to customize the home screen. I chose one with a day and night theme and its great!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and can't charge it. Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! My first Garmin purchase and was really looking forward to using this device. However, I can't even charge it. The USB cable included was a standard Aukey USB-C cable. Really? I didn't even peel the sticker off the watchface. It's going back and I'm not buying another one. If they can't even send the correct charging cable... so much for Garmin!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle J

customer_reviews.title: No speaker! You need bluetooth headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch as a whole, I just wish someone would have told me that you need seperate bluetooth earbuds/headphones to listen to it. There is no speaker on the headphones. You also can't send anything other than programed responses. HOWEVER, I loved the battery life on this. It charges from 0-100 in less than two hours. Their alarms will vibrate until you press stop, they don't choose to stop. This was a great, lightweight watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mope

customer_reviews.title: Hardly Works
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t download apps. Doesn’t connect to headphones. Outrageous numbers for “calories burned.” Chose this over Apple Watch for Spotify and it won’t even download; let alone connect to my headphones. Sending back and will never buy Garmin products again. Release products when they’re ready, not when you feel like it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Watch Band
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for about 2 years. The negative feedback I have is my husband can never connect to the app and both of our watch bands have been replaced multiple times. I don't usually write negative feedback but I thought it was worth it since we both had to replace bands again last night. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Choice watch for runners
customer_reviews.text: I came from a flashy Samsung smartwatch with all the bells and whistles. I mention that only because that's what made the switch to Garmin a little tough. It's just not as cool looking in style or screen graphics. Even with the brightness on high, it still looks dim. The battery life is ok but keeping my headset paired is a pain. Now that the negativity is out of the way let's talk positives! My Garmin makes me smile. Being able to track my running progress pushes me to do better. The connect app is awesome. It's like having an accountability partner.
customer_reviews.author: J Law

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Like the music feature. Downloaded my old saved songs. Very accurate. Downloadable watch faces. Funny thing though, it seems the bluetooth to my earbuds cuts out when the watch is on my left wrist while running, but not on my right wrist. Oh well, could be my earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: lpistol

customer_reviews.title: No Unicode language support
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is good smart watch; however, there is one major issue, which is.. the watch does not display any unicode language. Korean, Chinese, Japanese, etc... you name any unicode languages, those languages display as white box in the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Garmin Vivoactive 3 Music
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Vivoactive 3 Music is very useful as an entry level smartwatch and activity tracking. It sorta bridges the two (activity tracking and notifications) into one comfortable watch. Its not the best at any of those two. It's not at the level of the apple or samsung watches in terms of notification and its not at the level of the other garmin watches in terms of tracking. It is , however, good at everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: George Vendeta

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch three months ago, it was working great, but then I had a race. It was a day filled with running nothing else. At the end of the day there was spot on the watch face. It does not effect functionality but it does get in the way of reading different things. I didn’t hit the watch, as I said I spent the day running. I’m frustrated that something like this could happen with seemingly no reason other than using it for its designed function after only three months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak Screen
customer_reviews.text: I jumped into a pool and a small part of the screen had cracked. After that, it was at 60% and died within 15 minutes. It was not in GPS mode or anything like that. So it should of lasted a few days like that. On top of that, I bought it for the contactless pay and it does not support USAA. Other then that it is a great watch and it very customizable.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah Allen

customer_reviews.title: Vivoactive 3 is Poor for Golf
customer_reviews.text: The watch is ok overall. My issue is on the golf - GPS works fine for pin location. However, it does not allow you to pick walking or riding in a cart. When you ride in the cart, it thinks you are walking so the steps and stairs both reflect the distances you rode in the cart. As a result, the activist tracking is EXTREMELY inaccurate. I asked Garmin why this is the case and they have no answer - almost like their product team didn't realize that people sometimes walk on a golf course. The whole point of the watch is a moderately accurate representation of activity so this is a big gap.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I get 5 days give or take depending on use. Just normal day to day it will hit 6 days. Multiple watch faces are easy to install. The GPS without needing a phone is great. The app merges with my bike Garmin. The charger has always been an issue. In less than a year it will not connect to the watch. I am sending a warranty to Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Parke

customer_reviews.title: Have to Keep resetting to factory.
customer_reviews.text: The watch works, then something happens, and she has to delete everything out. The music is very cumbersome to listen to, and she has to reset everything to "fix" it. Which means she has to keep downloading music. The GPS when it works is very accurate, but we need to keep deleting everything out. She got it for christmas and has managed only 2 runs with it. She also can not figure out how to download the runs and see the mapping with mileage splits, which is avaliable for free phone apps. Save your money, and just use your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Moore

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!!! They have a lot of different watches to choose from but this one is great I can leave my phone at home while running and the watch plays my music and tracks everything
customer_reviews.author: jesse jay blair

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: Before getting the vívoactive 3 Music, I had the old school vívoactive fitness tracker and loved how accurate the watch was. But, recently I have ramped up the number of miles I run a week and wanted something to help cut down on what all I was taking with me on runs. Enter the vívoactive 3 music. This watch (and the aftershokz trek headphones) make running a breeze. The initial set up is super easy, the interface is extremely accessible, and going from leisure to working out just takes a press of one button. The battery charges relatively quickly and lasts for a good couple of days (depending how you use it).
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The reason i purchased this watch is that it allows me to play music without a subscription. I can put my workout music routine not have to carry a phone or have a subscription when I bike and run!! It has golf app as well that works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: B. G.

customer_reviews.title: Very good smartwatch for a first timer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a smartwatch and after reading all the reviews for Garmin vívoactive 3 Music here i have finally decided to have a go at it and it is definitely not a disappointment, battery life is really good, been using it for more than a week now and have charged it for a few times only, mobile apps were very helpful though i found the steps and floor climb counts inconsistent sometimes, gonna have to change settings probably to correct those, but overall i am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eomer068

customer_reviews.title: As a Pebble lover, it is a great watch.
customer_reviews.text: As a Pebble lover it is great to have a watch with a familar always on Memory LCD and great battery life (around a week). (My other watches: Pebble 2 HR + SE, Pebble OG, Huawei Watch 1, Fitbit Versa) Garmin does a lot of things right. Notifications are rock solid. Music works great and it's as simple as plugging into your computer and then drag-and-dropping songs into the watches music directory. This is a far bit better than the Fitbit Versa, which while a decent watch, has trouble staying in sync and is just awful transferring music to. Also Garmin provides an execellent SDK for those who like tinkering and developing their own Apps, widgets, and WatchFaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best by far!
customer_reviews.text: Best fitness watch I have owned by far! Great for daily goals, stress levels and forecast!! My battery lasts a week, easily- even with my notifications!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great watch minus the touch screen
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my old TomTom Spark. I actually prefer the old clunky button navigation on the TomTom over the touchscreen here. It takes several swipes to respond or it swipes unintentionally. As far as GPS, HR, music and all the related features, those seem to be top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: GPS - The watch looks great but the GPS worked for about a month and then would never connect to a satellite. Music - I also bought this watch for the blue-tooth music capability through spotify but that never worked either. It seems the technology is not there yet. Overall, not a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No More Walkman! :)
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how accurate the sleep monitoring is, it tells me that I barely get decent sleep and i do feel sluggish because of my sleep patterns, but something doesn't seem to add up. The gps is accurate. The music option is awesome no more carrying a phone... finally out of the Walkman Era!
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: No functional altimeter
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this watch for mountaineering and biking. In both cases I need a functional altimeter. Which here is completely absent. I am currently at an altitude of 400m meter over the ocean and the watch displays 170m altitude. That is a difference of 230m or 750 feet... There is no option to manually calibrate the sensor either. This renders the watch useless for my use but, except this, it is a good watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch. But I have to give is a bad review becoues it broke alittle after a year for not really reason the plastic cracked were the rist band connects to the watch. I expect a watch at this point to last a little longer. I wen I frist got this watch I loved the look and size of it and it seemed durable. I am so disapointad I have to give it a bad review after it broke well I was reading of all thing
customer_reviews.author: angela l jackson

customer_reviews.title: White Spot
customer_reviews.text: Nice until yesterday night. It shows a white spot with out a reason. I'd like to contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: Diego Cevallos

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Watch functioned OK. But 6 weeks in, glass developed a perfectly straight crack from edge to edge. No nick, scratch, or spidering to indicate any kind of impact. Turned on the music to go for a walk and it was fine. An hour later I take it off to get in shower, it had a crack. Garmin refuses to honor any kind of warranty. Will not buy any more Garmin products if that's how they long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Calbreath

customer_reviews.title: GPS not always accurate
customer_reviews.text: GPS not always accurate. Worn it for my routine 12km jogs in a forested area, about 30% of the time it loss tracking at different segments of the track. The music playback control is working very well 90% of the time. But Bluetooth disconnection is annoying at those 10% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: nc

customer_reviews.title: Overall very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Sleep tracking and its ability to track my bicycle cadence and speed. I purchased the watch a year ago and had some function problems after 6 months. Garmin sent me a new watch without any issues and the new watch has been going strong 6 months and counting!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Garmin!
customer_reviews.text: It is a good watch. Its touch system is very good. The heart rate is not as accurate, but it is approaching. It fulfills all its functions very well. I bought it to ride a bike and I use it with a cadence sensor, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: ligope5

customer_reviews.title: Cool bells and whistles but poor basic GPS function
customer_reviews.text: Having owned multiple garmin watches in the past (forerunner series), I've used this watch on some of the same courses as the previous watches. The GPS is consistently short by a significant enough amount to throw off pacing in workouts. The display pace on the watch will regularly sway by over a minute/mile despite no significant change in pace. One of the redeeming features of the watch is the ability to download music but even this has been finicky--occasionally not synching playlists despite good wifi connection. Overall disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Jake H

customer_reviews.title: Good Watch -- Disappointed Display and Quality
customer_reviews.text: For Such a price ,disappointing display Bad quality feel My friends said the Old one Amazefit Pace was better in built quality this looks like 20$ Watch In built features are good enough 4 rating because it serves the fitness purpose .. else its not worth it the Price buy Amazfit stratus or Ticwatch pro
customer_reviews.author: umer farooq

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for simple fitness tracking. Works great, battery life is way better than expected. I use it daily and utilize the tracking functions all the time. The battery lasts about 7-8 days of use. I have been using it for a couple months now and love this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Preston

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life and not as accurate
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good condition and well packed. Over all it is a good watch, however it dose have some issues: 1. Battery life is short. Used to be 4 days. After one year if use- I am now down to 1.5 days. And screen brightness is low. 2. Accuracy - stepse climbed, steps walked- watch usually misatkens. Sometimes i take the elevator - and it would calculate it as if i climbed 10 floors. 3. Accuracy- pulse - all in all- good.
customer_reviews.author: Shachar Porat

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but battery life does decrease
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch for everday smartwatch functions and for running, as it allows me to leave my phone at home and play music through Spotify. I did have trouble connecting Spotify, and then my google Pixel to the watch but Garmin's help desk was very helpful. I have noticed that my battery life has decreased over time for the watch - I expected this to happen, but not within the first 9 months of owning it. I would try the vivoactive 4 with music, if you are interested.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: My opinion
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the way it works in the way that it is and that it has to be able to get the phone to be used for what I am going through. I have no time for the situation of the process to get the best results in place
customer_reviews.author: Ammonia customers

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth didn't work at first
customer_reviews.text: Went through a lot of troubleshooting to get bluetooth to headphones operational. Had to reset and delete data, then connect to headphones before pairing to phone (not sure this was necessary) to get it to work. We'll see how it goes from here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as fancy as other watches but It will do just about what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Galaxy watch and it lasted me only 6 months. Purchase this because of the stand alone music capability. I hate running around with my Note10+ just to get the running app and music. With this watch all I need is my wireless headphones and Im good to go! I run 3 times a week and atleast 12miles and the battery last me 5 days before I recharge again which is already better than Galaxy watches.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dongon

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, get screen protector
customer_reviews.text: Great watch with good features. Music was kinda hard to get working every time I needed it but worked 7/10 times. I would get a protective screen or glass if you buy, my glass broke about 3 months into wearing it every day on a piece of metal. I will say that the HR monitor is spot on. Its the best I have found yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great for running with your tunes, without your phone!
customer_reviews.text: Great watch to run and listen to your Spotify tunes WITHOUT YOUR PHONE! Great features, now just make it auto rechargeable like the Samsung watch and it will be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but has a curved glass screen
customer_reviews.text: The watch does accurate tracking and the music feature is convenient for runs without a phone, but the screen is very fragile. I bumped my arm against the wall and cracked the entire screen. I would recommend getting a Garmin watch that does not have a curved glass, such as the vivoactive 3 without music. It is a fitness watch and I need to be a little more rugged
customer_reviews.author: Marinda Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Great on the trail and in the office
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It’s super accurate and reliable on long runs. It looks great on the wrist. The clincher for me is that it handles all of my work needs as well. Great all around smart watch!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Provan

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable device for serious training
customer_reviews.text: I've had this device for 6 months. I bought it for listening music and track my workouts. As a music player it works well although it is necessary to pair the headphones frequently. As a workout tracker (running and cycling) it fails miserably. It freezes, looses GPS constantly and does not work properly with the intervals in a workout. At this point I consider it an expensive music player.
customer_reviews.author: RPantoja

customer_reviews.title: Design Defect - Dead Pixels (2nd one to fail in less than a year)
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. These watches have a design defect that manifests within a year of usage. In this case, I've now had two of the same watches with the exact same failure. If you look at the images on this site, you'll find many other similar cases. Garmin has been unwilling to refund for the faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of this watch
customer_reviews.text: Love the extended life of this compared to my last fitness tracker. The GPS is not supper accurate on wooded trails, but that seems to be my only complaint. I've used the music storage for the few times I run without my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Joel McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on prime day because of the good sale price. This is a great smartwatch/fitness tracker combo. It gives plenty of insight on your activity, heart rate monitor is very accurate, and has neat features like spotify, music storage, and contact less payments. My only complaint is that when controlling music playing on the phone, the song names don't update on the watch face.
customer_reviews.author: Theodoros Rizos

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: got iy for my runner wife and she absolutely ”freggin loves it"!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good watch but not great for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Over all the watch is good. The only draw backs are is that it does not count swimming laps accurately. I swam 750 yards and it said I only swam 575 yards. Additionally the choices of watch faces is limited. I want a traditional face with the date but that option is not available. Other than this, the watch is good and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Easily broke
customer_reviews.text: I liked the watch but it broke very easily and I can't use it any more. I had the watch for about 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great until charging port fail!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch and then after the first year of having it, it stopped charging. Purchased a new charger and it still wouldn't charge. Garmin needs to come up with a different charging style to last longer than a year. Otherwise, watch was really good with everything its built for.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: matches my needs
customer_reviews.text: I loved the watch, it has ups and downs for both health tracking and smartwatch sides but in my opinion it still manages to keep a good balance between them, along with the really good battery life it beets all the other manufactures for me. The most thing I hate about it is the completely inaccurate and vague sleep tracking
customer_reviews.author: Amany EL-Guindy

customer_reviews.title: It's alright for a little bit
customer_reviews.text: It was good for a couple months then gps stopped working. It was pretty good, but my 645 is SO MUCH BETTER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I can't get the sleep part to work right yet, but everything else is terrific. I love this watch
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Continuous screen freezes despite resets, right of the box. Extremely disappointing for a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Samsung
customer_reviews.text: The watch is not compatible with some phones so not all of the features of the watch work. (Samsung phones not compatible). No notifications came through. After getting a replacement and having the same issue I looked into it and a lot of people experience the same issue, which is a bummer because the watch is really nice and simple. But if I’m paying for a feature, it’d better work.
customer_reviews.author: Paige I.

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother as a gift and then got myself one. It is so fast, has a long battery life and works well with any phone. I have owned other watches and would choose this over any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for activity tracking, but it has a couple software issues that are not terrible but annoying. The main thing is every time the software updates it reorders and resets your widgets menu. Not huge but has to be changed back in the app.
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my wife. She loves it. Much better value than other watches. But, buy a screen protector as my wife has scratched it up.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Repp

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! It is definitely water proofed since I swimed in the pool for hours. It can store many songs. The four star is because their software on the desktop was frozen and stucked when I tried to import the song to my watch.... It happens every time when I tried to import multiple songs. The data accuracy , well, I am not sure tbn.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Looks Awesome and Great for 5K Training.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve really enjoyed my watch. I use it everyday to train for a 5K. It’s been my motivation to workout every single day. It looks sleek and edgy with my medical scrubs and workout outfits, which is the look I was going for. It’s bulkier than the Apple Watch but that’s what I like about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Garmin VivoActive 3 Music
customer_reviews.text: Device is pretty comprehensive and covers most activities. The size is more suitable to a female wrist but has the advantage of being almost weightless. Integration with iOS and the Garmin connect app was simple and seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Sugan Naidu

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch but it’s small. Almost like a women’s watch. Maybe it is? I don’t know. The music feature is great. Easy to use once you get used to it and get the app on your phone to program your workouts. I plugged it in to my laptop and transferred iTunes song without a problem. No issues with it
customer_reviews.author: cbr

product_meta.title: Garmin 010-01985-01 Vivoactive 3 Music, Gps Smartwatch with Music Storage and Built-In Sports Apps, Black
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Watch| Style:With Music| Color:BlackFrom playing sports to playing your favorite songs, vasoactive 3 music is the smartwatch for your active life. It features on-device music storage, so you can bring your tunes along for every workout. This sporty smartwatch has wrist-based heart rate estimates and more than 1.
feature_bullets: GPS smartwatch with music storage and playback. Fits wrists with a circumference of 5 to 8 inches
Easily download up to 500 songs on your watch, and connect with headphones enabled with Bluetooth technology (sold separately) for phone free listening
Garmin Pay contactless payment solution (available for supported cards from participating banks) lets you make convenient payments with your watch, so you can leave your cash and cards at home
Customize with thousands of free watch faces, apps and more from our connect IQ store

More than 15 preloaded sports apps, including yoga, running, swimming, strength training and many more; The nexgadget replacement for Garmin charger is perfect compatible with our Vivoactive 3, we highly recommend it
Monitor your fitness level with VO2 max and fitness age estimates, plus keep an eye on how you handle stress through estimated heart rate variability
Battery life: Up to 7 days in smartwatch mode and up to 5 hours in GPS with music mode. Case material: Polymer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,214 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
